content.rendered:
Qatar is a viable country for various reasons. There are plenty of temptations that could make one scout Qatar for a Business Visa. A country that has been exporting oil for more than six decades offers a wide range of opportunities to start a very profitable career. Having just won the FIFA World Cup bid, there is a lot more to Qatar than what is seen today.

Qatar offers a life worth living: a professionally successful experience in a lavish style. A country with a hospitable culture and tax-free salary, the country welcomes expats with specialized skills and exceptional talent. The trick is to know everything you can before relocating to the city.

As in any foreign country, an expat needs to follow specific legal procedures before stepping across borders. While exploring business options in Qatar, talk to us before applying for a Qatar Business Visa. This will help you decide on the next course of action.

Qatar attracts many visitors for various purposes: business, personal and leisure. There are different kinds of visas provided for multiple purposes. In this blog, we will take a look at the Qatar Business Visa Requirements.

Qatar Business Visa

Note that when working for any Qatari company, you are eligible for the Qatar business visa. The responsibility to arrange for your visa lies with the company. Read here to know more about what you can do to expand your business to Qatar.

Steps to Apply

  • Fill the Qatar Visa Application Form.
  • Provide complete required documentation with signatures and validation wherever necessary
  • Bank statements, the itinerary and other valid proofs

Please note that no interviews will be conducted. All the documents provided by you will be checked and verified by authorities.

Now, there are two components of work in Qatar. First, you can apply for a work permit that entitles you to work for an employer in Qatar. Secondly, you can schedule a visit to your business venture. In both cases, you have to follow certain guidelines and procedures.

List of Documents required for Business Visa to Qatar

These are the different types of Qatar business visa. The following documents must be submitted for the same.

  • Passport valid for six months from the date of arrival in Qatar
  • Financial proof ( bank statement, for example)
  • Documents verifying your purpose of visit
  • A company letter
  • 2 coloured passport size photographs.
  • 2 copies of the first passport pages (photo and your name must be present in both
    copies) along with the original.
  • A letter of invitation from the sponsor with details regarding the relationship to the applicant. In addition, the letter must indicate details of stay (place and length) along with contact information
  • The Consulate of Qatar requires an official business letter to support your application.
  • Proof of Travel Arrangements along with the itinerary is required
  • Proof of sufficient funds in the form of a commercial bank statement showing the business activity is required. Military contractors can supply a letter of financial guarantee from their employer.

Types of Qatar Business Visa

The Qatar Business Visa does not permit you to live and settle down in Qatar Permanently. VIsiting Qatar on a business visa on a temporary business visa is, however possible. There are three types of Business Visa in Qatar

Business Visa: Visa obtained for contract work. The validity is 3 months. The worker signs a contract that enables him to stay in Qatar on a short-term basis. The visa is arranged by the employer. The employer operates a legally approved company in Qatar.
72-Hour Business Visa: This visa is issued upon arrival. It can be extended up to 72 hours. This business visa is preferable for short visits, usually for meeting potential clients or participating in a business event such as a convention.
Investor Visa: Included in the category of Business Visa, this is for those who wish to invest in Qatar. The option is viable only for selected ventures.

Visa Validity:

Visas for Qatar generally allow a stay of up to 1 month and are most commonly issued for a single entry, valid for 1 month or multiple entries valid for 6 months. Visa validity depends on the supporting documents and is at the discretion of the Visa Officer.

Visa Processing Time:

Qatar visas are usually processed in 6 to 8 business days. Rush or Emergency visa service may be available for additional fees.

On obtaining a business visa, passport holders of specific countries will be granted direct entry visa, without the need for the previous permits at the borders of the state. A company or a recognized establishment can apply to the Immigration Department. The permit has 2-week validity and can be renewed for another 2 weeks.

Businesspeople from countries such as the United States, Britain, France, Italy, Germany, Canada, Australia, New Zealand, Japan, the Netherlands, Belgium, Luxembourg, Switzerland, Austria, Sweden, Norway, Denmark, Portugal, Ireland, Greece , Finland, Spain, Monaco, the Vatican, Iceland, Andorra, San Marino, Lichtenstein, Brunei, Singapore, Malaysia, Hong Kong, South Korea are eligible for the visa.

However, the visa will be subject to the laws relating to entry and residency of foreigners. It is also dependant on the current rules for the residents of GCC countries.

Why Future Focus Infotech?

Business Visas are issued to business people who have applied in advance. It is prudent to book for a business visa via a global employment agency to ensure that all formalities are taken care of. The set-up process can take a month to four months. With Future Focus Infotech, all you have to do at your end is to tell us when you would like to be in Qatar. Setting up a Business in Qatar is more than just a plane ticket and Visa. We help you take care of all the intricate processes that come with it. We are a Global Employment Organization that takes care of payroll processing, HR related procedures and all other formalities.

We will ensure that everything else is taken care of. Give us a call to find out more about how we can collaborate to make your venture in Qatar a successful one.
